name: Kepler-385
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-385 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-385 is a star with 1.1839999999999997 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.13 times its radius. It is located 4872.57 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-385 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-385 b

Kepler-385 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.04 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-385.

The mass of Kepler-385 b is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-385 b is 2.73 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-385 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-385 c

Kepler-385 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 15.16 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-385.

The mass of Kepler-385 c is 13.85 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-385 c is 3.04 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-385 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-385, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
